title: PhD Student Interview

title: Registered Nurse Interview

title: Academic Advisor Interview

Interview Questions: Tell us about a time you worked with a student of concern. What was the situation and how did you handle it?

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: Overall very easy, staff is very friendly and willing to work with you as you settle into the interview. Went in post-covid and found that they were also very flexible with working from home / in office schedule. Very pleased overall

title: Senior Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: There were multiple Zoom interviews and no in-person interviews. This was over COVID so not sure if this is the normal case or not. Managers and colleagues were involved in the interview process.
Interview Questions: What from your background makes you desirable for this role?

title: Event Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of three rounds of interviews, all virtual, with colleagues on the team. The entire process took about a month start to finish, and I started a month after getting my offer letter - I was fortunate to have been given the opportunity to choose my start date.
Interview Questions: The interviews consisted of many situational questions.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: It was a simple interview process that consisted of 2 interviews. The first interview was on zoom and the second interview was in person where I met the team, got a tour, and sat in on a meeting.
Interview Questions: You are expected to be able answer the question "tell me about yourself?"

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at George Washington University in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: The first round of interviews was a panel interview with typical questions. The second round was an all day (eight hour) interview with panels of people from the entire department. I was also expected to create a 30 min presentation for the entire department. I felt that this was ridiculous for an entry level position with below average pay. I removed myself from consideration for this position.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself/What are some highlights in your work experience? Explain further your proficiency with programming languages? Describe a technical problem or need you addressed using code you wrote. What was the problem and how did your code solve the problem or meet the need? If possible, please provide an example in which you used either Ruby on Rails or Python. What interested you about this position at GW? Where do you see yourself a few years from now? Tell us about a time you have disagreed with a colleague, and how you handled it.

title: Paralegal Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University in Nov 2022
Interview Descriptions: I applied for the position online on GWU's website. About 2-3 weeks later, a staff coordinator/EA reached out to schedule a Zoom interview. He was very pleasant and was able to accommodate me when I needed to reschedule the interview due to a personal conflict. The actual interview was via Zoom, and a panel of 5 (I believe) people, including at least 3 attorneys, took turns asking me questions. I thought it went well but evidently not well enough, since I did not make it to the next round of interviews. About 3-4 weeks later, I received an email saying that the job had closed (no reason given), so I assume they filled the position, or that a hiring freeze had taken effect.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work for George Washington University? Do you have any litigation or intellectual property experience?

title: Student Support Staff Interview

Interview Descriptions: It was a great opportunity for students to get started especially when I do not have many experienced. They scheduled an interview and asked couple questions. Received the result within 1-2 days.

title: Event Coordinator Interview

title: Nurse Interview

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: A preliminary phone interview: Interviewers conduct a preliminary phone interview to understand whether a candidate possesses the required skills for the job. This can save time and effort spent on interviewing all candidates face to face and help streamline the pool. An appropriate skill test: A skill test is a good way to determine whether candidates can perform a job efficiently. There may be different kinds of skill tests to evaluate your personality or your suitability for a role. An in-person interview: To get an in-depth understanding of a person's background and abilities, interviewers often have to conduct an in-person interview. Interviewers can also inform the candidates about the work style and culture followed by the organisation or company. A group panel interview: In this stage, the panel may be comprised of people with different areas of expertise. Each panel member may ask you questions pertaining to a particular domain. Presentations: Interviewers can also ask candidates to prepare a slideshow, video or physical presentation that best illustrates their skills and abilities.
Interview Questions: Behavioural and technical questions literally

title: Research Technician Interview

Interview Questions: What is translation? What is transcription? How does translation work?

title: Program Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Initially the interview process was very smooth. The managing director, accounting manager, and previous program coordinator who I would be replacing  were all extremely friendly and seemed very transparent. I first had a skype interview with two people, and it was more of a low key conversation to get to know each other. Then, I was invited for an in person interview in DC. The in person interview was with the same two people I skyped with, plus an financial manager. We discussed a few more financial and accounting responsibilities, but again the process seemed very conversational and comfortable. 

I was provided an offer a week later. I asked for 24 hours to think it over and came back with a counter offer. My initial thoughts were that our interactions were so comfortable and my conversations with the hiring manager seemed so flexible and transparent that having a conversation about negotiating an offer would be totally OK. I was wrong. Two days  after I sent a counter offer, I got a letter rescinding my offer. There was no explanation; it was just an email with two sentences saying they were going in a different direction. When I asked for further explanation, I was given none. I understand this was totally in their right but I felt like not even being allowed to have a conversation about salary offers seemed rather extreme. 

In today's society, as women, we are taught to never accept the first offer and to always negotiate. I would have thought that a higher educational institution would have promoted this idea. The beginning of this entire experience was great; however I found the end of the process to be extremely unprofessional and rather embarrassing for GW.
Interview Questions: How much financial and accounting experience do you have? And how do you stay organized when you have multiple tasks to juggle?

title: Communications Strategist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: Several rounds or interview, starting off with a phone call. Group interview with the team and a tour of the campus.  Process moved fairly quickly and was able to get to know the role
Interview Questions: What is in your portfolio

title: Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: Started great, coordinating with the hiring department. But once HR got involved, things got sloppy and responses took forever. It finally worked out in the end but was an indication of things to come.
Interview Questions: About my experience

title: Director of Finance - MPH Program Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions: I first completed a phone interview. This was followed by a day long interview with staff within the department. Everyone was extremely friendly, and I was told that I was one of three candidates. A week after the interview, I hadn’t heard a peep. I emailed them and heard nothing back for a month. They never apologized for the delay or for being unresponsive but instead contacted me to tell me they’d like me to consider applying for a different job. They attached the description. They seemed to think they were doing me a favor, but they were drumming up candidates. I never responded. Interviews go both ways!
Interview Questions: Lots of questions surrounding federal grants and contracts.

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: The interview consisted of 2 rounds. The first round of the interview was with the hiring manager over the phone. The the second round was an on-campus panel interview. GW was easy to interact with throughout the process. Very knowledgeable human resources department, and staff.
Interview Questions: Why GW?

title: Colonial Collection Caller Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: The group interview was laid back and focused on what you do at school, your personality, and how you take criticism. They just wanted to see if you were committed to the school and showing up to a job at the available times.
Interview Questions: How well do you respond to constructive criticism?

title: Assistant Director of Development Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Mar 2019
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an online application, heard back within a week for a phone interview. A week after the phone interview, I was scheduled for a 3-4 hour in-person interview with multiple departments, including a panel. Following the interview I never hear back from any parties at GW, even after following up. Very unprofessional and I generally had a negative experience because of it. Almost a year after I applied I received an automated email that I had not received an offer. I think part of the program stems from the fact that they do the hiring within the department with limited involvement from HR.
Interview Questions: Regular interview questions

title: Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: It's a phone interview. the interviewer is very nice and ask me about 7 questions. The interview starts from 2 pm and the at last the interviewer answers my questions
Interview Questions: What's your working style? How do you confirm confidentiality of customers?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: Online application via job portal. They emailed me to set up an in-person interview. It was very casual and they basically wanted an overview of my work experience.  I answered honestly to the best of my ability. I was called back one week later with the confirmation.
Interview Questions: What makes you a good candidate for the role?

title: Speech-Language Pathology, Graduate Student Clinician Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was a phenomenal experience.  The faculty answered all of my questions and if they didn't have an answer they were honest about it and then followed up with me soon after so that I had all the answers I needed to make my decision to attend school here.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with someone who is difficult to work with?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty simple. I was directly interviewed by the faculty member.  Mostly the questions were focused on the description. Previous contributions to research were asked to be elaborated.
Interview Questions: Research field working in at this moment.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: I applied online via GW's career page. I received an email a week later about wanting to do a phone interview. I interviewed with the Department Chair and his assistant. It was about 25 min long. They went over my resume and asked me about my experience and why I would be a good fit for the position.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 10 years?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It started on time, and it was very professional, very formal, not too long, not too short. The atmosphere was calm and friendly, I did not feel too nervous. I had a chance to ask questions and got comprehensive responses.
Interview Questions: What are your best accomplishments in the last 5 years?

title: Colonial Temps Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: This is for the Colonial Temps program. The process involves you speaking with university HR department staff who tells you about the program and ask you about your employment experience. The Colonial Temps program is simply a temp agency/staffing agency operation. All of the jobs are only in office administration and are strictly temp jobs. The temp jobs do not lead to any permanent employment whatsoever with the university. The program requires candidates to undergo a background check and reference check. It is simply a temp agency/staffing agency and nothing. The Colonial Temps is not good for candidates who wish to pursue a career in broadcast/multi-platform journalism, television news, and/or print journalism.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your employment experience?

title: Special Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions:
I received a call a few days after applying to the position, looking to set up a phone interview. The phone interview took place at the end of that week and consisted of a basic overview of the position and questions about my skills – as standard phone screening. Shortly thereafter, an in-depth, multi-panel interview was requested.

The interview consisted of several panels of 2-3 interviewers spending 20 minutes questioning me and allowing 10 minutes of my questions; the general focus was directed at assessing fit.
Interview Questions: If you were arranging travel and accommodations for a faculty member from a foreign university with an exchange program with GW, how would you go about it?

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: The interview was on skype. Generally going through some key traits they found important based on the CV/Resume. Since it is a fellowship position, there are multiple professors involved and there were discussions about collaborations.
Interview Questions: How many years of experience that you had using  Remote sensing and GIS tools? Which tool you prefer?

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was notified that I was being offered a Skype interview with a panel. Prior to that, I had been asked by an admin to prepare answers to a number of pretty specific questions about my portfolio and work products. I didn't necessarily expect to get the job, but I did expect to be treated better than I was. After my interview, I got no further communication. I spent a total of about five hours preparing the links I sent and getting pre-approval from HR at my current employer to be able to share more specifics (if asked). The interview itself took close to two hours, including the time it took to get to a quiet place and prepare myself at the end of a work day. I was very disappointed that after putting so much time and effort into this process, I got no follow-up from the team whatsoever. Not even a response from the admin after I requested an update (after 2.5 weeks). This is the most unprofessional experience I have had in my job search. Though I have had other rejections, GW is the only organization that has given no response or courtesy at all.
Interview Questions: How would you go about working with subject matter experts?

title: Administrative Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview included a virtual interview, as I am an out of state candidate and a performance task. The performance task instructions had a plethora of errors and I had to follow up a week after my initial interview to receive the performance task instructions. The person who was to send the information to me did not, and responded by saying "oh, I thought I sent it to you". I was rushed to complete the task and received no feedback on the task that took some time to complete.
Interview Questions: How do you manage to work with individuals with strong personalities?

title: Communications Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Contacted by email to have a 20-30 minute phone interview. Both the email and phone call were conducted by the hiring manager and an office employee, not an HR representative. I just have to say, when the hiring manager and employee laugh at you, there are big problems.
Interview Questions: General phone interview questions. Tell me about your previous work experience and how it relates to this job.

title: Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I was invited via e-mail to have an interview, which took about 30 minutes total. A lot of behavioral questions were asked. I was then asked to provide 2 references. After a couple of days I received the job offer.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me a little about yourself?

title: International Student Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: After my application, I got contacted in about a week for a phone interview. It lasted about 25 minutes with a very kind interviewer who would be my supervisor. I thought I did very well, she was engaged and seemed impressed with my interest in the position. I felt great about it! I sent her a thank you email as I waited to hear back about the next steps. When a week went by without a response, I emailed the secretary who had set up our email. No response. A month went by without a reply to my inquiries and I just received an automated email about their decision, telling me that they chose to go with another candidate. Although I assumed I did not get the position, I wish they hadn't left me hanging!
Interview Questions: Do you have direct or indirect experience with international student visas?

title: Library Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions:
To be perfectly honest this was a distinctly  negative experience from start to finish.

I saw the position online, created and filled out my profile and submitted my application. A few weeks later I received an email letting me know I had been selected to interview for the position and included a list of available interview times.

Only one problem...the "available" dates had already passed. Several hours later I received a second email, luckily this one listed available future dates.

On to the day of the interview itself...I arrived at the location about 15 minutes early and checked in so they knew I was there. At the appointed hour I was greeted and told that the previous interview was running late. My interview, which was set for 11:00, didn't start until around 11:30. Once the interview finally started, one of the panel spent almost the entire time with her eyes glued to her laptop, not even looking at me while she asked me questions. Maybe that was her method of taking notes, or maybe she was on Facebook or something the whole time, but it was quite unnerving.

After the interview concluded, I got the standard "we will make our decision in a week and let you know" routine. Well, that was September 2018, this is January 2019, and I've heard nothing. Now I know by checking my profile that the position was filled, and not by me obviously, but they could have at least sent me the perfunctory "thanks for your interest, the position has been filled" email but I got nothing. If you interview someone you at least owe them that much. Maybe I dodged a bullet by not being hired if this is how they treat prospective employees.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Very convenient. Did the walk in Wednesday’s and was able to meet up with managers and walk around the units that same day. Staff at the Human Resources friendly and professional.
Interview Questions: Experience related to my job description, patient safety questions.

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: The interviews were scheduled a week apart after having my application for a month. However it took them almost a month to get back to me after I kept asking every week for an updated timeline. And every week it was 'next week, next week'. They had me on the hook for so long and it was really unprofessional. I will be applying again but not to that department.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with a adult online population?

title: Discourse Laboratory Manager Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: The interviewer asked me a couple of questions about my resume and if I had taken any anthropology classes before. It was over in about 10 minutes and I was told I got the job within a couple of days.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Peer interview led by another student assistant. Then, management interviews individuals, asking a series of questions decerning how students will interface with prospective students or those coming into the office.
Interview Questions: How might you interact if a prospective student is concerned about the political environment in DC?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: Screening call with hiring manager, on-site with 2 different groups, 1-1 call, follow-up calls with hiring manager (7 contacts). Process overviewed on HR website, they should follow it. Critical information about the position withheld, including salary. Obvious that they were hedging their bets, their first choice accepted the job (so they should not've contacted my references the same day). As I pointed out in one of the MANY interviews - this is a 2 way street. They are just typical while acting as if they are forward thinking.
Interview Questions: Why did you leave the last job? (I completed the long online system. Perhaps share that info so time is not wasted).

title: Administrative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Short tour of facilities and conversation about the position. Took about 30 minutes total.
A lot of open-ended, behavioral questions were asked. It was odd in that the position did not have a complete description and the hiring manager couldn't even explain exactly what I would be hired to do. It was difficult to answer questions about why I want the position when there is no clear job description.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Accounting Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: The interview process is pretty straight forward. Expect a panel style interview. With the possibility of multiple rounds. You will normally interview with hiring manager and team members or people that you will work closely with from various departments.
Interview Questions: Describe something difficult that you’ve encountered at work and the steps you took to resolve the matter.

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Rockville, MD) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions: it was not a good experience at all for me they were rude and cohesive and not professional at all I was not happy they are not nice they pay awful I hate this job they are the worst
Interview Questions: what are you good at

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: I just submit my resume and cover letter through the online board, and after several months, they give me a reply and let me to go interview. I believe I had a good performance on that so they gave me this opportunity to stay.
Interview Questions: Q: Why are you choosing this company but not others?

title: Database Administrator Interview

Interview Questions: Basic DB questions

title: Research Assistant Interview

title: Career Coach Interview

title: Research Assistant Interview

Interview Descriptions: Very casual, resume questions about explaining your resume. There were also some behavioral questions, and questions about what skills your bring to the table and proficiency in microsoft office, specifically excel.
Interview Questions: Name a time you had to figure out how to do something?

title: Financial Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: I applied on their website. I received an email that I have a phone interview. Afterwards, they invited me for in-person interview at the campus. It takes 2 weeks process.
Interview Questions: Describe your strength and weaknesses.

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 months. I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: After applying online via their portal, there was an initial phone interview that lasted about 20 minutes. I was then invited to a Skype panel interview with three department staff. The interview process took several months. The overall process took about four months. HR was extremely slow to process the paperwork and I didn't receive the offer letter until the start date.

title: Facilities Customer Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: It was a panel with 3 people/...  They was friendly and informative. Interview was very comfortable.  I would review job applied for and ask questions accordly for this position.
Interview Questions: What are you bringing to GWU??

title: Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: Had 2 interviews and was never followed-up with.  Had to find out I didn't get the job via the online application database.   The interview process wasn't conducted in a very timely fashion.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with a difficult constituent

title: ICU RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: I applied online, was called by the nurse recriter to set up an interview appointment, then I was interviewed by a nurse on the floor I applied.  I was offered to shadow on the floor about a week after the interview.
Interview Questions: Why should I hire you?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: One phone screening with the Director and AVP and then a panel interview with 3 sets of interviews with members of central development and alumni relations. Whole process lasted about 2 months.
Interview Questions: What fundraising experience do you have

title: Technical Services Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Applied online through Handshake with my resume (Handshake is open to students only and is a job aggregator).  I was contacted to come to an in-person interview.
Interview Questions: Do you have any prior experience working in tech assistance?

title: Postdoctoral Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: I had initiated my talks with the PI in Dec 2015 and got the offer in Jun 2016. There were almost three interviews conducted over Skype due to my then location, including a talk over video call.
Interview Questions: All technical questions about Biological Sciences and the specified projects.

title: Student Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was pretty chill. The program director and I grabbed coffee and talked about my qualification for this position. They understand that it is student applying so it is generally easy
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in the position?

title: Student CSA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: Quick and efficient, the questions were pertinent to the responsibilities of the role.  The manager was courteous and well humoured.  I would reccommend to other students for sure.
Interview Questions: What type of challenges with students have you witnessed before and how have you confronted those issues.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Very informal, through the PI / faculty member on the study. Email went out on our student listserv and I was able to apply via e-mail, then go through the hiring process from there.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in research?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in May 2017
Interview Descriptions: I was asked to Teach a course that I did well in as an undergraduate student. I am continuing my research that I started as an undergradute student at the Masters Level. The research is focused on optical computing.
Interview Questions: I was asked to give a demonstration lecture on an introduction to sets and graphs for the course I was going to be teaching on the foundations of computing.

title: Graphic Designer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: I had an initial screening interview over the phone, followed by an interview in person, with multiple groups of people I would be working with. The 2 group in-person interviews took about 1-2 hours total. Then it was over a month after that when I heard back that they had pursued other candidates, despite attempts to follow up and get an update on the process.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite type of design project to work on?

title: Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: I introduced myself. They asked machine learning and development questions. Then they talked about their projects. At last, they asked me about my career goal and why I applied this lab.
Interview Questions: What's the difference between passing by reference or by value?

title: Lobbyist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Two step - first with the director and the second with the office staff. The first step appeared to be directed toward experience and knowledge and the second toward office culture. Office culture was weighted more heavily than experience and knowledge.
Interview Questions: The second stage group interview had less to do with what the candidate knew or could accomplish and more to do with whether or not they would fit into the office culture. I was stunned to be asked "what was my favorite fruit".

title: Statistical Consultant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: Just ask me why I would like to apply for this job and also my advantages and disadvantages. I have tried my best to show them I can manage to get this job.
Interview Questions: Just ask me why I would like to apply for this job and also my advantages and disadvantages.

title: Tech Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was okay. I applied through school and it was a positive experience. people were extremely friendly. nothing technical was asked during the interview. It was mostly behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Why this position?

title: Postdoctoral Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at George Washington University (Ashburn, VA) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I spoke with the P.I. but I actually worked for a month before I was given a formal offer.  It was really an interview. I was hired from my Resume.
Interview Questions: I wasn't asked many perplexing questions. I explained what molecular electronic research was about and the P.I was impressed.

title: Administrative Associate, Planned Giving Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: I had a phone interview with an employee with went very well. Next, I was invited for an in person interview from 9am - 1pm with the Estate team. I met with each person one in one. Everyone was very professional and kind. They wanted to know more about my experience with estates and administrative work. The next step of the process involved an in person writing test which I declined due to another job offer.
Interview Questions: What are two personal characteristics you need to improve?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: Phone screen and then a panel interview.  Lots of behavorial based questions.  Phone screen lasted 30 minutes, panel lasted an hour.  Took a long time from verbal offer to actually starting.  Hiring process is slow.
Interview Questions: How I deal with conflict

title: Department Operations Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Met with the Operations Manager, Department Chair, and Deputy Chair and answered questions.  They asked about past work experience and discussed the nature of the job I was interviewing for.
Interview Questions: What makes you a viable candidate for this job?

title: Executive Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied to this position through GW Jobs, then emailed the Director and Founder directly. After some back and forth, she invited me to her office for an in-person interview. I get the sense that she circumvented the usual HR process at GW and then, after she decided to bring me on, pushed HR to bring me on-board. The actual interview with her went great - it felt more like a conversation than anything else. We talked about spiritual care, why it was important to me, how she started this field, and things like that. We are both ENFPs (I think), so it was a good, fast-paced, and very broad conversation.
Interview Questions: Why do you think whole person care is important?

title: Admissions Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Jul 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Based on past experiences, the interview is suppose to start by stating what the position entails and introductions  from around the room.  The department manager never really went into detail about the position and what to expect, frankly, she didn't even touch upon the position. Secondly, how do you interview someone for only 9 minutes? I was bewildered and it seemed like the room didn't have any further questions to ask. I know in my experience when sitting in on interviews, you're supposed to have questions readily available. Even towards the end of the short interview, the department manager exhibited signs like she couldn't be so bothered. Not a good impression even if you aren't interested in the candidate. 


While this has left a sour taste, I'm sure it was only this department,  and doesn't reflect the entire GWU community.
Interview Questions:
1. Tell me about yourself
2. Why GWU
3. What questions do you have for us?
4. In what ways have you worked with different populations of students?


Apparently the staff didn't have any further questions to ask.

title: Office Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at George Washington University (Los Angeles, CA) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview lasted about thirty minutes. It was pretty straight forward. Simply was asked about my experience and willingness to meet the basic mission and vision standards. Be familiar with the universities goals and use your skills to add further value to the institution.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to the Office Assistant Job?

title: Clinical Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: Applied online for the position and was called in several weeks later. Met with the senior coordinator and the PI. Was given a tour of the lab and met with a few of the members. Was very informal. Was told I would hear back after reviewing several candidates and never heard from them.
Interview Questions: What is your experience in research?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Meeting with search committee, select members of faculty, and the dean. These were the good old days when the university had a very friendly culture of sharing and caring.
Interview Questions: Questions related to teaching and research portfolios and expected career plans.

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: the interview itself took 20 minutes the process was 2-3 days, i had good relationship with the professor seeking GTA the wage was not discussed and the position was available in the beginning of the following semester
Interview Questions: This is what we are going to do for the semester are you okay with it?

title: Facility Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted by the George Washington University HR department. I was asked a few general interview questions, and then told that I would receive an email for the next step.
Interview Questions: I was asked to tell a little bit about myself

title: Transcript Evaluator Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: Smooth, relaxed. Interviewer spent a few minutes describing the role and answering my questions, then asked about me. Afterwards, I was tested on transcribing the transcripts. I was given four different transcripts from four different regions in the United States. I spent a few minutes on each one and asked questions during the process to clarify. It was very simple, not too much pressure.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: EEO Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions:
Received email requesting a writing sample and wanting to interview next morning by telephone. Interview by telephone was very pleasant. Second interview scheduled - I was going to be nearby so I went to campus. It was booked quickly as well. 

I arrived early and I was clean and dressed in a suit. After they saw me, which included multiple people coming to the door, calling to me from a distance, then telling me they'd be with me in a minute (before they were late), the interview began late, and changed from an "interview" to an "informal meeting". 

Neither of the interviewers had a lick of interest. I felt like I was begging them to ask me questions, which was greeted with, "I think we are all set". I asked about expectations, and the desired skills dramatically changed from the actual job description. One example was wanting advanced technology experience, so I asked if they wanted to know about my experience: "no". I tried to talk about components of the job description that I had been asked about over the telephone, and they played those tasks down as being a minor part of the job. I finally asked why they called me in for an interview if I wasn't what they were looking for, and they became very defensive and blamed me saying simultaneously, it was I who had come to that conclusion.  

It was truly awful. Who would have thought EEO would be an actual actor in discrimination? I tried to follow up with their legal department and, no surprise, they denied the behavior, the bias, and denied what was clearly in  writing from their own staff (basic stuff like, oh, it was an interview). 

If I had made a special trip to this area of the world for just this interview, I think my internalizing their bad behavior and discriminatory conduct would not been as embarrassing and mortifying, but would have been rage inducing.
Interview Questions: Do you have experience with the ADA?

title: Human Resources Director Interview

title: Residential Facilities Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions:
I applied to the position and was contacted by an HR representative three weeks later to set up an interview over Skype. We were emailing back and forth to set up the appointment. In the middle of this exchange the HR rep sends an email saying that the interviews have been cancelled and that she would be contacting candidates later. 

A few days later I got a form email from the HR rep instructing all candidates who had been invited to an in-person interview to submit availability. I hadn't even completed a Skype interview but played along and scheduled a time.

The interview was scheduled and I was emailed instructions etc. I showed up to the interview and it started without any problems. 

The interview consisted of panelists reading questions off a sheet and grading my responses. One panelist jokingly made a comment about how she thought my answer to her question was too long.  The interview wrapped up with the HR rep asking an "easy" question, but it was so complicated that I had to ask her to repeat it. Seriously, the question was so long that the HR rep fumbled through it. I still honestly feel like I performed very well during the interview, but in retrospect I don't think I had a chance.

The second the interview was finished all the panelists bolted out of the conference room. I don't think I've ever seen a room empty out so fast. It was disrespectful to say the least.

I sent a thank you note and got no response of course. A month later I got an automated rejection letter which was kind of rude because I invested a lot of time into the process. Just to make it worse, their application system sent me the rejection letter over and over again for the next few days.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself....

title: Assistant Director, Alumni Affairs Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at George Washington University
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was extraordinarily long and drawn out.  I sent in my application and received an invitation to a phone interview the next week.  After my phone interview I didn't hear back from them for 6 weeks at which time I was asked to come in for an in-person interview...in the next two days.  Post interview it was another 5 weeks until I was invited to come back for a second in-person interview.  Following that interview, it was another 6 weeks until I heard that I didn't get the job.  I'm not sure that the folks there understand that interviewing is an expensive endeavor: clothing, travel, printing costs, etc.  There really didn't seem to be any kind of attention paid to the time an interviewee devotes to the process.  Coming from out of town to in-person interviews that took about an hour/hour and a half just didn't feel like it was worth my time.

title: Administrative Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC)
Interview Descriptions: The Administrative Manager position was advertised on the GWU website. There was an online form that had to be completed, and then cover letter & resume were requested as attachments. References were included in the job form.  Invited for a 30 min phone interview by email 1.5 months later.
Interview Questions:
Phone interview:

The panel interview involved three people from human resources. One main person asked the questions, and the other two panelists asked 1 or 2 questions each. They were filtering final candidates for the on-campus interviews. 

These were the questions for the 30 minute phone interview:

1) Tell us about yourself
2) Tell us what you know of what an Administrative Manager does.
3) Tell us about your administrative experience
4) Tell us why you want to work at GWU
5) Did you seek & complete any outside training  to improve your performance as an employee (out of your own initiative)?
6) Tell us about your tech skills (Microsoft products, databases like Banner, web design, social media, etc.)
7) How long have you been unemployed? What have you been doing during this period of unemployment?
8) If we contacted your previous employers, what would all of them say about you?
9) Why do you feel that you are the best fit for this position?
10) Do you have any questions for us?

The questions were straight forward  and they weren't confusing. If you share additional information about yourself, be prepared to explain it very quickly and with a minimum amount of words. They will ask follow-up questions if you deviate from the main questions.

It really wasn't that bad. No need to be super nervous (for the phone interview, at least).

title: Administrative Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at George Washington University (Washington, DC) in Jan 2011
Interview Descriptions: Unfortunately, there isn't a choice of  "Scheduled for interview, interviewee never showed up" b/c that is exactly what happened to me.  Was scheduled for an interview at one of GWUs academic offices - Administrative Manager position - but when I arrived in DC I got lost (of course) and called the office over 30 times but no one answered the phone.  It was not during normal lunch hours and I placed those 30+ calls well before my interview was scheduled.  After driving around DC for FOUR hours (yes, 4), I pulled over and tracked down a direct phone number to the person who was supposed to interview me.  She apologized and communicated that the person I was coordinating w/ was unexpectedly pulled into a meeting w/ her.  My thoughts:  There's only one person around to cover phones?  I've worked in a large University for over 6 years and I know better.  The interviewee (which happened to be one of the heads of the department) was not willing to go forward w/ the interview and instead suggested a phone interview.  So, I rescheduled for a phone interview and her assistant called me and informed me, minutes before the interview was supposed to take place, that she was pulled into yet another meeting.  So, I rescheduled again!  The time came for the interview and I received no phone call from anyone!  The lack of organization and professionalism portrayed by those employees put a bad taste in my mouth and I decided not to bother with following up.
Interview Questions: N/A

The questions were relatively straightforward, and they were interested in hearing my ideas for some problem areas they were hoping my position could tackle.  They then had me write a sample piece of correspondence given very limited information, while on location (only a small portion of my job description).  They called me back a few days later to schedule a 15-minute time with the executive I would be supporting.  He was most concerned with hearing a quick, direct summary of why I wanted to be there, but we chatted longer than scheduled.  A few days after that they reached out to me to get my permission to contact my references via a paper signoff.
